function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Inaccurate temperature measurements","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of wind data during air change rate experiments","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of sulfur hexafluoride as a tracer gas","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inconsistent handling of tracer cylinders between california and virginia houses","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-low"},{"name":"Use of b&k multigas photoacoustic analyzers for measuring sf6 concentration","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential cross-contamination between houses","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inaccurate measurement of air change rate","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate ventilation and air exchange rates in different zones of the house","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Positive reading of sf6 under clean air conditions and in cases of nonzero residual levels of sf6 in the house","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Relatively low standard errors for the calculated air change rates","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Tracer gas concentration uniformity among and within rooms","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Strong stack effect in the virginia house, resulting in uneven tracer gas concentration on each floor","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential reverse stack effect at the virginia house during the summer months","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Tracer concentrations exceeding safe levels due to poor mixing and ventilation","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Tracer gas release leading to uneven distribution and concentration of contaminants","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Multizone situation created by opening windows allows for the rapid spread of contaminants","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Different tracer concentrations in multiple compartments can lead to uneven distribution of contaminants","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inaccurate measurement of tracer decay rates","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Overestimation of air change rates","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Unreliable conclusions on air flow dynamics","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Variability of air change rates in different seasons","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Bimodal distribution of air change rates","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Meteorological parameters affecting air change rates","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Variation in air change rate due to window opening width and location.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Difficulty in establishing a simple relationship between air change rate increases and the width of opening of a single window.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Rapid tracer decay or ’whoosh’ observed after opening a window, leading to a short-lived, significant dilution of existing tracer gas in the immediate air volume.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Rapid clearing out ’whoosh’ effect of tracer gas after window opening","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Multiple window opening experiments showing increased air change rates","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Tracer gas concentrations decayed to below detection limits within a short time after window opening","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Influence of meteorological factors on air change rates may impact the spread of contagious diseases in indoor environments","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased air change rate due to window opening","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increase in air change rate due to window opening","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Presence of turbulent eddies at the window opening","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inaccurate air change rate measurement due to transient effects","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of quantified relationship between air change rate and window opening width in real homes","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increase in air change rate due to window-opening behavior leading to variability in indoor air quality","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Effect of wind speed and occupancy on air change rates in homes","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"High air change rates due to occupant behavior","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inability to differentiate between air loss to outdoors and to adjacent apartments","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-low"},{"name":"Low air change rates in occupied houses","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased correlation between indoor and outdoor pollutant concentrations","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Open windows may lead to the uneven distribution of pollutants in a building, with some areas experiencing rapid reduction in pollutant concentration while others take longer to clear","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Rapid influx of air when opening a window increases the air change rate","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Dependence of air change rate on window width and elevation","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Significant increase in air change rate with multiple open windows","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited information for policy decisions","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Unknown effects of anti-contagion policies on infection rates","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of historical precedent for the current pathogen and policies","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Costs of anti-contagion policies are visible, while health benefits are unseen","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Business restrictions increase unemployment and school closures affect educational outcomes","category":"Society","confidence":"High"}]}
